started uh thank you all for being here
today my name is Jesse suen I am a
co-founder and CTO of Acuity and one of
the original creators of the Argo
project um so we're here at argoon and
you might expect me to be singing the
Praises of Argo CD and giops but
actually uh today I'll be spending a
little time kind of explaining some of
the challenges with giops um and some
some of the things that Argo CD isn't
great at um and why we feel that more
tooling needs to be developed to improve
that uh developer
experience uh a little bit about Acuity
um we are a team founded by Argo
creators leads maintainers of the Argo
project uh and we help uh companies
Implement giops with Argo um AI offers
an easy the manage platform for running
a more scalable and secure version of
Argo CD um and we also offer Solutions
and support for the Argo
project okay so if you think about what
giops is it's really more of a
philosophy then and not really a
solution um basically gitops is just
adding additional rules and constraints
on how you should be deploying changes
to your environments but it really
doesn't provide any guidance on the
practices or processes that uh to go
about achieving that so at the end of
the day gitops just made things harder
for everyone because a lot of this stuff
that we were previously doing um before
giops in our CI pipeline they no longer
worked after
giops um and when we when we built Argo
CD we built it as a tool to help
practice gitops but it was it was never
enough it it's great at deploying
changes um from a g repository to a
single environment but there's a lot of
things that it doesn't do first it has
no understanding of multiple
environments or a concept of a pipeline
to orchestrate changes across
environments um it doesn't even let uh
help you write changes to get because it
expects some other tool to do that ahead
of time and finally once it does sync an
app it doesn't do any verification of
that update after the fact such as
running any form of tests or or
analysis
so over the years uh a number of small
features and Argo lad projects have
cropped up to kind of uh deal with with
these limitations and I call these a
spot Solutions because each of these
tools or these features only solve one
piece of the puzzle and uh none of these
consider the bigger picture or or the
overall developer experience um and with
all these approaches it just feels like
we're kind of trying to Brute Force Argo
C into something it was really never
designed to
do um so we set out to kind of build a
tool that approaches the challenges of
gups in CD holistically um we wanted the
solution to provide a flexible pipeline
to Define how changes are promoted
between different environments um we
wanted an intuitive UI for um that gives
a better understanding about um what was
or needs to be or about to be promoted
um we wanted to hide the gitops nuances
to developers who frankly don't really
care about gitops um and we wanted to
provide guard rails ensuring that
promotions are happening uh within
defined
processes so cargo is an open source
project that we recently announced uh to
fill in these gaps um and it's a
multi-stage giops application
orchestration tool for promoting changes
through through multiple
environments um and our biggest goal of
cargo is to provide a better more
intuitive layer on top of your giops
tooling um we want to enable application
developers to safely promote their apps
through multiple environments and for
normal day-to-day operations we envision
app developers to be visiting the cargo
UI U more often than the Argo CD UI uh
because uh to promote their changes
dayto day they still go to Argo CD when
there's a problem you see logs events
but um in the happy path cargo would be
used more often to deploy
things so with cargo you'll get um you
know better visibility into your
promotion process you seeing all your
environments of the glands understand
what's running where and what's safe to
deploy um you'll be able to see history
of what um was deployed along with links
back to your source code repo and commit
history um and we built it for with the
gitops use case in mind and one of the
unique features about art cargo is its
ability uh to promote configuration not
just images and in other words you're
able to promote manifest changes like
environment variables from stage to
Stage uh cargo makes get write backs and
roll backs really easy with a one click
and finally you can start practicing uh
Progressive delivery by um qualifying
your artifacts uh before they're allowed
to deploy to other
stages so if you're interested in check
